name: The Exorcist Steps
description: Famous steep steps in Georgetown featured in the 1973 horror film 'The Exorcist'. These 75 stone steps connect M Street to Prospect Street.
funFact: The steps are 75 steps high and became a popular spot for movie fans and fitness enthusiasts!
hint: Hidden in Georgetown near the university...

name: The Temperance Fountain
description: A historic fountain donated in 1882 to provide water for horses, dogs, and humans. A unique three-tiered design promoting temperance.
funFact: It was designed to discourage alcohol consumption by providing free drinking water!
hint: Look for a special fountain near the National Mall...

name: Einstein Memorial
description: A 12-foot bronze statue of Albert Einstein sitting on a granite bench, located near the Vietnam Veterans Memorial.
funFact: The statue weighs 4 tons and features Einstein holding papers with mathematical equations!
hint: Seek genius near the Constitution Gardens...

name: The Zero Milestone
description: A small monument that serves as the symbolic center of all highways in America. Located south of the White House.
funFact: Erected in 1923, it was intended to be the starting point for measuring distances to other US cities!
hint: Find the center of all roads south of the White House...

name: The Darth Vader Grotesque
description: A carved grotesque on the National Cathedral's northwest tower depicting Darth Vader's head, added after a design competition for children in the 1980s.
funFact: It's on the northwest tower and requires binoculars to see from ground level!
hint: Look up high at the National Cathedral...
